channel.title: EasyRSC v2 Requests
channel.description:
Lately i have been gaming a lot and in-need of a new project, i had no idea that EasyRSC v1 was going to get used as much as it did so i somewhat made it a little half assed and rushed it.
I plan to make a 2.0 as an extension, with more user requested features & even easier if thats possible. I should make a tutorial GUI with flashing arrows telling you which order to press the buttons to get started (joke)
You may:
Request anything to make it easier to get started Request anything to add to the UI (Control Panel) to make things easier Request me to implement some common publically known & fixed dupes/server crashes Request anything that was buggy about the old EasyRSC 1.0 to be fixed
You may not:
Request anything to do with sprites, landscape or any of the sort implemented to make it easier Request any in-game minigames such as CTF etc Request any in-game updates (fix ranging through walls, cannon not working etc) because i'm not developing your servers for you.
The client will not be touched, so don't ask for any client related updates
I don't have an ETA on this project, nor can i guarantee it will be finished (as i start many projects and scrap them) I will be adding plugin support for this, so future or quick UI updates can be distributed easily, and/or you can share EasyRSC extensions.

item.title: EasyRSC v2 Requests
item.dc:creator: @rune2h rune2h
item.description:
@rune2h wrote:

I dont understand why you and that jon guy keep complaining about easyrsc bugs when there is a noobscape v3 source out there with most of your problems fixed. I think you need to try using it because you obviously do not know what you are doing.

This thread is about how xent can make v2 better. It’s not about switching to a “better” one. I don’t think noobscape is better though. All yong min did was add a bunch of custom stuff that was never even in runescape classic. EasyRSC is authentic. Get off this thread if you’re not going to be helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v2 Requests
item.dc:creator: @toddfost006 toddfost006
item.description:
@toddfost006 wrote:

[quote=“rune2h, post:43, topic:317404”]I’ve edited EasyRSC for a long time (I love it btw), so I know the main problems with it.

  1. It would be nice to include a guide on how to do simple stuff like replace the login picture. Maybe even include the tools to do that also. Also in the guide, show us how to change the color of the loading bar and the buttons, and show us how to edit Loading.rscd (by dragging it to paint). I already figured these things out, but it was difficult.

  2. Make sure that no ladders or stairs lead to a black area (only a few do this).

  3. Let people use ::stuck in the wilderness. It’s possible to get stuck in a black area, so you should be able to use ::stuck. It takes 10 seconds after a fight to use it anyway, it’s not a problem.

  4. Include an easy webclient.

  5. Fix usernames with spaces and that problem where it creates a username without the first letter of your username sometimes.

  6. Add sounds. It was really difficult for me to get this working by myself. I could give you the fix for that if you want. ***This one is the biggest problem. Sound is 25% of the game to me.[/quote]

I dont understand why you and that jon guy keep complaining about easyrsc bugs when there is a noobscape v3 source out there with most of your problems fixed. I think you need to try using it because you obviously do not know what you are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v2 Requests
item.dc:creator: @rune2h rune2h
item.description:
@rune2h wrote:

I’ve edited EasyRSC for a long time (I love it btw), so I know the main problems with it.

  1. It would be nice to include a guide on how to do simple stuff like replace the login picture. Maybe even include the tools to do that also. Also in the guide, show us how to change the color of the loading bar and the buttons, and show us how to edit Loading.rscd (by dragging it to paint). I already figured these things out, but it was difficult.

  2. Make sure that no ladders or stairs lead to a black area (only a few do this).

  3. Let people use ::stuck in the wilderness. It’s possible to get stuck in a black area, so you should be able to use ::stuck. It takes 10 seconds after a fight to use it anyway, it’s not a problem.

  4. Include an easy webclient.

  5. Fix usernames with spaces and that problem where it creates a username without the first letter of your username sometimes.

  6. Add sounds. It was really difficult for me to get this working by myself. I could give you the fix for that if you want. ***This one is the biggest problem. Sound is 25% of the game to me.

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC v2 Requests
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

Dunno if your still thinking of doing this but there are a few things that come to mind that could make life easier.

1.Ip banning from the UI.
2.Create a limit on the number of accounts a user can have.

3.Depending on how hard/easy it would be/if you would be willing to do it (as i know you dont want to touch the client) - have a client built into the UI - have player seizing so the admin can take over the player via the client in the UI - just a thought.

Have fun

item.title: EasyRSC v2 Requests
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Why not build in SQLite for a small database storage platform in place of text files?

SQLite is a software library that implements a self-contained, serverless, zero-configuration, transactional SQL database engine. SQLite is the most widely deployed SQL database engine in the world. The source code for SQLite is in the public domain."

http://www.sqlite.org/whentouse.html

You figure that saving to text files is the fastest and easiest way but there are two large downsides to this - player save files are incredibly difficult to translate into human readable information and its difficult to parse into various web-integrated uses such as highscores and user login authentication systems. No SQL to configure but IMO it is more difficult reading the player text files. Make the server GUI able to modify all of the player attributes.

A light database can run without the end user having any idea but it can enable those who can utilize it to do a whole lot more than what is currently possible.

The only issue would be for noobs who cannot edit databases. The server comes with a GUI so all we would need is to build in more functionality such as password and rank changing.

Read full topic
